00028 /**
00029  * A persistent pool of Applications.
00030  *
00031  * Spawning Ruby on Rails application instances is a very expensive operation.
00032  * Despite best efforts to make the operation less expensive (see SpawnManager),
00033  * it remains expensive compared to the cost of processing an HTTP request/response.
00034  * So, in order to solve this, some sort of caching/pooling mechanism will be required.
00035  * ApplicationPool provides this.
00036  *
00037  * Normally, one would use SpawnManager to spawn a new RoR application instance,
00038  * then use Application::connect() to create a new session with that application
00039  * instance, and then use the returned Session object to send the request and
00040  * to read the HTTP response. ApplicationPool replaces the first step with
00041  * a call to Application::get(). For example:
00042  * @code
00043  *   ApplicationPool pool = some_function_which_creates_an_application_pool();
00044  *   
00045  *   // Connect to the application and get the newly opened session.
00046  *   Application::SessionPtr session(pool->get("/home/webapps/foo"));
00047  *   
00048  *   // Send the request headers and request body data.
00049  *   session->sendHeaders(...);
00050  *   session->sendBodyBlock(...);
00051  *   // Done sending data, so we close the writer channel.
00052  *   session->closeWriter();
00053  *
00054  *   // Now read the HTTP response.
00055  *   string responseData = readAllDataFromSocket(session->getReader());
00056  *   // Done reading data, so we close the reader channel.
00057  *   session->closeReader();
00058  *
00059  *   // This session has now finished, so we close the session by resetting
00060  *   // the smart pointer to NULL (thereby destroying the Session object).
00061  *   session.reset();
00062  *
00063  *   // We can connect to an Application multiple times. Just make sure
00064  *   // the previous session is closed.
00065  *   session = app->connect("/home/webapps/bar")
00066  * @endcode
00067  *
00068  * Internally, ApplicationPool::get() will keep spawned applications instances in
00069  * memory, and reuse them if possible. It will try to keep spawning to a minimum.
00070  * Furthermore, if an application instance hasn't been used for a while, it
00071  * will be automatically shutdown in order to save memory. Restart requests are
00072  * honored: if an application has the file 'restart.txt' in its 'tmp' folder,
00073  * then get() will shutdown existing instances of that application and spawn
00074  * a new instance (this is useful when a new version of an application has been
00075  * deployed). And finally, one can set a hard limit on the maximum number of
00076  * applications instances that may be spawned (see ApplicationPool::setMax()).
00077  *
00078  * Note that ApplicationPool is just an interface (i.e. a pure virtual class).
00079  * For concrete classes, see StandardApplicationPool and ApplicationPoolServer.
00080  * The exact pooling algorithm depends on the implementation class.
00081  *
00082  * @ingroup Support
00083  */
00084 class ApplicationPool {
00085 public:
00086         virtual ~ApplicationPool() {};
00087         
00088         /**
00089          * Open a new session with the application specified by <tt>appRoot</tt>.
00090          * See the class description for ApplicationPool, as well as Application::connect(),
00091          * on how to use the returned session object.
00092          *
00093          * Internally, this method may either spawn a new application instance, or use
00094          * an existing one.
00095          *
00096          * @param appRoot The application root of a RoR application, i.e. the folder that
00097          *             contains 'app/', 'public/', 'config/', etc. This must be a valid
00098          *             directory, but does not have to be an absolute path.
00099          * @param user The user to run the application instance as.
00100          * @param group The group to run the application instance as.
00101          * @return A session object.
00102          * @throw SpawnException An attempt was made to spawn a new application instance, but that attempt failed.
00103          * @throw IOException Something else went wrong.
00104          * @note Applications are uniquely identified with the application root
00105          *       string. So although <tt>appRoot</tt> does not have to be absolute, it
00106          *       should be. If one calls <tt>get("/home/foo")</tt> and
00107          *       <tt>get("/home/../home/foo")</tt>, then ApplicationPool will think
00108          *       they're 2 different applications, and thus will spawn 2 application instances.
00109          */
00110         virtual Application::SessionPtr get(const string &appRoot, const string &user = "", const string &group = "") = 0;
00111         
00112         /**
00113          * Set a hard limit on the number of application instances that this ApplicationPool
00114          * may spawn. The exact behavior depends on the used algorithm, and is not specified by
00115          * these API docs.
00116          *
00117          * It is allowed to set a limit lower than the current number of spawned applications.
00118          */
00119         virtual void setMax(unsigned int max) = 0;
00120         
00121         /**
00122          * Get the number of active applications in the pool.
00123          *
00124          * This method exposes an implementation detail of the underlying pooling algorithm.
00125          * It is used by unit tests to verify that the implementation is correct,
00126          * and thus should not be called directly.
00127          */
00128         virtual unsigned int getActive() const = 0;
00129         
00130         /**
00131          * Get the number of active applications in the pool.
00132          *
00133          * This method exposes an implementation detail of the underlying pooling algorithm.
00134          * It is used by unit tests to verify that the implementation is correct,
00135          * and thus should not be called directly.
00136          */
00137         virtual unsigned int getCount() const = 0;
00138 };

00142 /**
00143  * A standard implementation of ApplicationPool for single-process environments.
00144  *
00145  * The environment may or may not be multithreaded - StandardApplicationPool is completely
00146  * thread-safe. Apache with the threading MPM is an example of a multithreaded single-process
00147  * environment.
00148  *
00149  * This class is unusable in multi-process environments such as Apache with the prefork MPM.
00150  * The reasons are as follows:
00151  *  - StandardApplicationPool uses threads internally. Because threads disappear after a fork(),
00152  *    a StandardApplicationPool object will become unusable after a fork().
00153  *  - StandardApplicationPool stores its internal cache on the heap. Different processes
00154  *    cannot share their heaps, so they will not be able to access each others' pool cache.
00155  *  - StandardApplicationPool has a connection to the spawn server. If there are multiple
00156  *    processes, and they all use the spawn servers's connection at the same time without
00157  *    some sort of synchronization, then bad things will happen.
00158  *
00159  * (Of course, StandardApplicationPool <em>is</em> usable if each process creates its own
00160  * StandardApplicationPool object, but that would defeat the point of having a shared pool.)
00161  *
00162  * For multi-process environments, one should use ApplicationPoolServer instead.
00163  *
00164  * @ingroup Support
00165  */
00166 class StandardApplicationPool: public ApplicationPool {
00167 private:
00168         static const int CLEAN_INTERVAL = 62;
00169         static const int MAX_IDLE_TIME = 60;
00170 
00171         friend class ApplicationPoolServer;

00173         typedef list<ApplicationPtr> ApplicationList;
00174         typedef shared_ptr<ApplicationList> ApplicationListPtr;
00175         typedef map<string, ApplicationListPtr> ApplicationMap;

00178                 mutex lock;
00179                 condition countOrMaxChanged;
00180                 
00181                 ApplicationMap apps;
00182                 unsigned int max;
00183                 unsigned int count;
00184                 unsigned int active;
00185         };

00189         struct SessionCloseCallback {
00190                 SharedDataPtr data;
00191                 weak_ptr<Application> app;
00192                 
00193                 SessionCloseCallback(SharedDataPtr data, weak_ptr<Application> app) {
00194                         this->data = data;
00195                         this->app = app;
00196                 }
00197                 
00198                 void operator()(Application::Session &session) {
00199                         mutex::scoped_lock l(data->lock);
00200                         ApplicationPtr app(this->app.lock());
00201                         
00202                         if (app != NULL) {
00203                                 ApplicationMap::iterator it(data->apps.find(app->getAppRoot()));
00204                                 if (it != data->apps.end()) {
00205                                         if (app->getSessions() == 0) {
00206                                                 // TODO: make this operation constant time
00207                                                 it->second->remove(app);
00208                                                 it->second->push_front(app);
00209                                         }
00210                                         data->active--;
00211                                 }
00212                                 app->setLastUsed(time(NULL));
00213                         }
00214                 }
00215         };

00236                 return false;

00239         void cleanerThreadMainLoop() {
00240                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00241                 while (!done) {
00242                         xtime xt;
00243                         xtime_get(&xt, TIME_UTC);
00244                         xt.sec += CLEAN_INTERVAL;
00245                         cleanerThreadSleeper.timed_wait(l, xt);
00246                         if (done) {
00247                                 break;
00248                         }
00249                         
00250                         ApplicationMap::iterator appsIter;
00251                         time_t now = time(NULL);
00252                         list<string> appRootsToRemove;
00253                         
00254                         for (appsIter = apps.begin(); appsIter != apps.end(); appsIter++) {
00255                                 ApplicationList &appList(*appsIter->second);
00256                                 ApplicationList::iterator listIter;
00257                                 list<ApplicationList::iterator> elementsToRemove;
00258                                 
00259                                 for (listIter = appList.begin(); listIter != appList.end(); listIter++) {
00260                                         Application &app(**listIter);
00261                                         if (now - app.getLastUsed() > MAX_IDLE_TIME) {
00262                                                 P_TRACE("Cleaning idle app " << app.getAppRoot());
00263                                                 elementsToRemove.push_back(listIter);
00264                                         }
00265                                 }
00266                                 
00267                                 list<ApplicationList::iterator>::iterator it;
00268                                 for (it = elementsToRemove.begin(); it != elementsToRemove.end(); it++) {
00269                                         appList.erase(*it);
00270                                 }
00271                                 if (appList.empty()) {
00272                                         appRootsToRemove.push_back(appsIter->first);
00273                                 }
00274                         }
00275                         
00276                         list<string>::const_iterator it;
00277                         for (it = appRootsToRemove.begin(); it != appRootsToRemove.end(); it++) {
00278                                 apps.erase(*it);
00279                         }
00280                 }
00281         }

00287         void handleConnectException(const exception &e, const ApplicationPtr &app,
00288                                         ApplicationList &appList) {
00289                 string message("Cannot connect to an existing application instance for '");
00290                 message.append(app->getAppRoot());
00291                 message.append("': ");
00292                 message.append(e.what());
00293                 appList.remove(app);
00294                 if (appList.empty()) {
00295                         apps.erase(app->getAppRoot());
00296                 }
00297                 count--;
00298                 active--;
00299                 throw IOException(message);
00300         }

00309          *            will be written to this log file. If an empty string is

00311          *            will use the same standard output/error channels as the
00312          *            current process.
00313          * @param environment The RAILS_ENV environment that all RoR applications
00314          *            should use. If an empty string is specified, the current value
00315          *            of the RAILS_ENV environment variable will be used.
00316          * @param rubyCommand The Ruby interpreter's command.
00317          * @throws SystemException An error occured while trying to setup the spawn server.
00318          * @throws IOException The specified log file could not be opened.

00320         StandardApplicationPool(const string &spawnServerCommand,

00344         virtual ~StandardApplicationPool() {
00345                 if (!detached) {
00346                         {
00347                                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00348                                 done = true;
00349                                 cleanerThreadSleeper.notify_one();
00350                         }
00351                         cleanerThread->join();

00356         virtual Application::SessionPtr
00357         get(const string &appRoot, const string &user = "", const string &group = "") {
00358                 /*
00359                  * See "doc/ApplicationPool Algorithm.txt" for a more readable description
00360                  * of the algorithm.
00361                  */
00362                 ApplicationPtr app;
00363                 ApplicationList *appList;
00364                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00365                 
00366                 if (needsRestart(appRoot)) {
00367                         apps.erase(appRoot);
00368                 }
00369                 
00370                 try {
00371                         ApplicationMap::iterator it(apps.find(appRoot));
00372                         if (it != apps.end()) {
00373                                 appList = it->second.get();
00374                 
00375                                 if (appList->front()->getSessions() == 0) {
00376                                         app = appList->front();
00377                                         appList->pop_front();
00378                                         appList->push_back(app);
00379                                         active++;
00380                                 } else if (count < max) {
00381                                         app = spawnManager.spawn(appRoot, user, group);
00382                                         appList->push_back(app);
00383                                         count++;
00384                                         countOrMaxChanged.notify_all();
00385                                         active++;
00386                                 } else {
00387                                         app = appList->front();
00388                                         appList->pop_front();
00389                                         appList->push_back(app);
00390                                         active++;
00391                                 }
00392                         } else {
00393                                 while (count >= max) {
00394                                         countOrMaxChanged.wait(l);
00395                                 }
00396                                 app = spawnManager.spawn(appRoot, user, group);
00397                                 appList = new ApplicationList();
00398                                 appList->push_back(app);
00399                                 apps[appRoot] = ptr(appList);
00400                                 count++;
00401                                 countOrMaxChanged.notify_all();
00402                                 active++;
00403                         }
00404                 } catch (const SpawnException &e) {
00405                         string message("Cannot spawn application '");
00406                         message.append(appRoot);
00407                         message.append("': ");
00408                         message.append(e.what());
00409                         throw SpawnException(message);
00410                 }
00411                 
00412                 app->setLastUsed(time(NULL));
00413                 
00414                 // TODO: This should not just throw an exception.
00415                 // If we fail to connect to one application we should just use another, or
00416                 // spawn a new application. Of course, this must not be done too often
00417                 // because every app might crash at startup. There should be a limit
00418                 // to the number of retries.
00419                 try {
00420                         return app->connect(SessionCloseCallback(data, app));
00421                 } catch (const IOException &e) {
00422                         handleConnectException(e, app, *appList);
00423                         // Never reached; shut up compiler warning
00424                         return Application::SessionPtr();
00425                 } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00426                         handleConnectException(e, app, *appList);
00427                         // Never reached; shut up compiler warning
00428                         return Application::SessionPtr();
00429                 }
00430         }
00431         
00432         virtual void setMax(unsigned int max) {

00436         }
